BlockIcon.comment: Searching for the fin of orca, assuming that the icon ends at the first empty line or block pattern. (?!^.*<@%.*%@>.*$|^[ \t]*$).* -- not empty or block

BlockShark.comment: Non-special line is defined by (?!.*[-*#=]{7,})(?!.*<@%)(?!.*%@>)(?:(?!\n).)*. <@% %@> is the internal marker for blocks.

BlockWarnings.comment: Starts with ===, then WARNINGS, then up to 3 non-special lines inside of header, then ===, then non-special lines, then one more non-special line, but \n is outside of the main search bracket. Non-special line is defined by (?!.*[-*#=]{7,})(?!.*<@%)(?!.*%@>)(?:(?!\n).)*. Non-special line might be empty. <@% %@> is the internal marker for blocks.

pattern_texts.BlockLibXc: Your ORCA version has been built with support for libXC

BlueprintParagraphStartsWith.comment: Blueprint: Starts with specified text, followed by non-empty lines, then one more non-empty line, but \n is outside of the main search bracket

BlockOrbitalBasis.comment: Starts with Orbital basis set information, then non-empty non-special lines, then one more non-special line, but \n is outside of the main search bracket. Non-special line is defined by (?!.*[-*#=]{7,})(?!.*<@%)(?!.*%@>)(?:(?!\n).)*. <@% %@> is the internal marker for blocks.

BlockAuxJBasis.comment: Starts with Orbital basis set information, then non-empty non-special lines, then one more non-special line, but \n is outside of the main search bracket. Non-special line is defined by (?!.*[-*#=]{7,})(?!.*<@%)(?!.*%@>)(?:(?!\n).)*. <@% %@> is the internal marker for blocks.

BlockInputFile.comment: Header then wait till === line will reappear

BlockFinalSinglePointEnergy.comment: This pattern matches the final single point energy block in an ORCA output file. It looks for a line of 25 dashes, followed by a line with FINAL SINGLE POINT ENERGY, and then the energy value represented by an optional minus sign followed by one or more digits, a period, and more digits. This is encapsulated within a pattern of dashes that frame the title and the value.

BlockTotalRunTime.comment: This pattern captures the total runtime block in an ORCA output, displaying the computation time in days, hours, minutes, seconds, and milliseconds. Each time unit is followed by its respective label (e.g., days, hours), and the values can be any number of digits.

BlockSuggestedCitations.comment: Assumes that List of optional additional citation will be present in the citations block. It is followed by empty line and then nonempty non-special lines.  Non-empty non-special line is defined by (?!^[ \t]*$)(?!.*[-*#=]{7,})(?!.*<@%)(?!.*%@>)(?:(?!\n).)*. <@% %@> is the internal marker for blocks.

BlockTimingsForIndividualModules.comment: This pattern is intended to identify the timings for individual modules within an ORCA computation. It starts with the heading Timings for individual modules:, followed by up to four newlines, then captures multiple lines that describe individual modules and their timings in seconds. Each module line includes the module name followed by an ellipsis and the timing in seconds, potentially followed by additional text, before ending with a newline.

BlockUnrecognizedWithHeader_1.comment: This pattern stands for -*#= line followed by no more then 2 non-special lines then -*#= line then non-special lines then -*#= line. Non-special line is defined by (?!.*[-*#=]{7,})(?!.*<@%)(?!.*%@>)(?:(?!\n).)*. Non-special line might be empty. <@% %@> is the internal marker for blocks. This is the final attempt to recognize the blocks with headers. Does not work with DOTALL. Is repeated twice cause overlap.

BlockUnrecognizedWithHeader_2.comment: This pattern stands for -*#= line followed by no more then 2 non-special lines then -*#= line then non-special lines then -*#= line. Non-special line is defined by (?!.*[-*#=]{7,})(?!.*<@%)(?!.*%@>)(?:(?!\n).)*. Non-special line might be empty. <@% %@> is the internal marker for blocks with header. This is the final attempt to recognize the block. Does not work with DOTALL. Is repeated twice cause overlap.

BlockUnrecognizedNotification.comment: What's left and looks like a notification

BlockUnrecognizedMessage.comment: What's left and looks like a single line message

BlockUnknown.comment: I have no clue what that is but it is not empty and is not my marker

Spacer.comment: Just some empty lines, may have tabs and spaces
